requirement_tested: A frontend application that fetches all dynamic data from backend APIs
user_persona: A trivia enthusiast named Alex who wants to participate in online knowledge competitions.
user_goal: Alex wants to browse available contests and view contest details without seeing any hardcoded content.

narrative_steps.title: Visiting the Homepage
narrative_steps.description: Alex opens the trivia app homepage expecting to see a list of live contests.
narrative_steps.action: Navigate to the root URL of the application.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The frontend makes an API call to http://localhost:3001/api/contests and displays dynamically loaded contest cards with titles and descriptions.

narrative_steps.title: Viewing Contest Details
narrative_steps.description: Alex clicks on a contest card to learn more about it before enrolling.
narrative_steps.action: Click on a contest card.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The app navigates to the contest detail page and fetches question data via the /contests/{contestId}/questions endpoint, rendering the information dynamically.

requirement_tested: A backend application connecting to a PostgreSQL database using specified environment variables
user_persona: A developer named Taylor deploying the trivia app backend service.
user_goal: Taylor wants to ensure the backend connects securely to the PostgreSQL database using predefined environment variables.

narrative_steps.title: Starting Backend Service
narrative_steps.description: Taylor sets up the required environment variables and starts the backend server.
narrative_steps.action: Run `npm run dev` in the server directory with environment variables set: DB_HOST=localhost, DB_PORT=5432, DB_USERNAME=myappuser, DB_PASSWORD=myapppassword, DB_NAME=myapp.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The backend initializes successfully and establishes a secure connection to the PostgreSQL database instance using the provided credentials.

narrative_steps.title: Accessing Database Records
narrative_steps.description: Taylor verifies that the backend can retrieve contest records from the connected database.
narrative_steps.action: Make a GET request to /api/contests endpoint.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The backend responds with a list of contests retrieved directly from the PostgreSQL database.

requirement_tested: User authentication and session management for contest participation
user_persona: Jordan, a new user interested in joining a trivia contest.
user_goal: Jordan wants to sign up, log in, and remain authenticated throughout the contest session.

narrative_steps.title: Signing Up
narrative_steps.description: Jordan visits the site for the first time and decides to create an account.
narrative_steps.action: Navigate to /signup and fill out the registration form with valid details.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Upon submitting the form, Jordan receives a confirmation message and is redirected to the login page.

narrative_steps.title: Logging In
narrative_steps.description: Jordan logs into the newly created account to access the contest features.
narrative_steps.action: Enter valid credentials on the /login page and click the 'Login' button.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Jordan is authenticated with a JWT token stored in localStorage and redirected to the homepage showing available contests.

narrative_steps.title: Session Persistence
narrative_steps.description: After some time, Jordan returns to continue participating in a contest.
narrative_steps.action: Return to the site within 2 hours of last activity.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Jordan remains logged in and can access protected routes like contest enrollment and question answering without re-authentication.

requirement_tested: Contest browsing interface displaying available knowledge competitions
user_persona: Morgan, an avid trivia participant looking for new challenges.
user_goal: Morgan wants to explore currently available trivia contests easily.

narrative_steps.title: Opening Contest Browser
narrative_steps.description: Morgan lands on the homepage eager to find interesting trivia contests.
narrative_steps.action: Visit the homepage which automatically loads the contest browser.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: A responsive grid layout populated with contest cards featuring titles, descriptions, start/end times, and default images appears.

narrative_steps.title: Exploring Contest Cards
narrative_steps.description: Morgan scrolls through several contest cards to understand what's offered.
narrative_steps.action: Scroll down the contest listing page.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Additional contest cards load smoothly without full page refresh, maintaining beige background and saddle brown accents throughout.

requirement_tested: Contest enrollment functionality allowing users to join competitions
user_persona: Casey, a regular trivia player wanting to compete in upcoming contests.
user_goal: Casey aims to enroll in an open contest and confirm successful registration.

narrative_steps.title: Finding an Open Contest
narrative_steps.description: Casey browses the available contests and identifies one starting soon.
narrative_steps.action: Browse contests and locate an open contest card labeled 'Enroll Now'.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The contest card shows a prominent 'Enroll Now' button styled in saddle brown.

narrative_steps.title: Enrolling in the Contest
narrative_steps.description: Excited about the contest topic, Casey clicks to join.
narrative_steps.action: Click the 'Enroll Now' button on the selected contest card.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: A modal confirms successful enrollment, and the button text changes to 'Already Enrolled'.

requirement_tested: Interactive question display interface showing one question at a time
user_persona: Riley, a focused contestant ready to tackle today’s trivia challenge.
user_goal: Riley wants to navigate through contest questions efficiently and intuitively.

narrative_steps.title: Starting the Quiz
narrative_steps.description: Riley has enrolled in a contest and begins answering questions.
narrative_steps.action: Click 'Start Quiz' on the contest detail page.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The first question is displayed prominently with multiple-choice options or free-text input field, accompanied by a countdown timer icon.

narrative_steps.title: Navigating Between Questions
narrative_steps.description: After selecting an answer, Riley moves forward to the next question.
narrative_steps.action: Select an answer choice and click the 'Next' button.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The screen transitions smoothly to the next question while preserving the saddle brown-styled navigation controls.

requirement_tested: Answer submission system for users to provide responses to contest questions
user_persona: Quinn, a competitive trivia lover aiming for top scores.
user_goal: Quinn wants to submit answers quickly and accurately during the contest.

narrative_steps.title: Answering a Multiple Choice Question
narrative_steps.description: Quinn encounters a multiple-choice question and selects the best option.
narrative_steps.action: Choose a radio button representing the preferred answer and click 'Submit Answer'.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The selected answer is sent to the backend via POST /contests/{contestId}/answers, and Quinn proceeds to the next question or receives immediate feedback.

narrative_steps.title: Submitting Final Answers
narrative_steps.description: At the end of the quiz, Quinn submits all remaining answers.
narrative_steps.action: Click the final 'Submit Answers' button after completing the last question.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: All unsubmitted answers are sent to the backend, ending the quiz session and redirecting Quinn to the score dashboard.

requirement_tested: Real-time scoring mechanism calculating user performance
user_persona: Sam, a strategic player tracking progress during the contest.
user_goal: Sam wants to monitor real-time score updates as they answer questions.

narrative_steps.title: Initial Score Display
narrative_steps.description: Before starting the quiz, Sam checks their baseline score status.
narrative_steps.action: Load the contest question interface.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: A score panel displays initial value (e.g., 0 out of total possible points) in the top corner with beige background and saddle brown borders.

narrative_steps.title: Receiving Instant Feedback
narrative_steps.description: After submitting an answer, Sam expects immediate scoring feedback.
narrative_steps.action: Submit an answer to a question.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The score panel instantly updates to reflect earned points, including potential time-based bonuses, providing instant gratification.

requirement_tested: Personal score dashboard displaying individual user results and rankings
user_persona: Taylor, a stats-oriented trivia fan reviewing personal achievements.
user_goal: Taylor wants to analyze past performances and track overall ranking trends.

narrative_steps.title: Accessing Personal Dashboard
narrative_steps.description: After finishing a contest, Taylor heads to the personal score dashboard.
narrative_steps.action: Navigate to /dashboard/scores.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The dashboard renders a visual chart showing historical scores alongside a rank indicator badge and list of past contests with individual rankings.

narrative_steps.title: Reviewing Detailed Results
narrative_steps.description: Curious about a specific contest result, Taylor dives deeper.
narrative_steps.action: Click on a contest listed under the history section.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Detailed results including correct/incorrect answers and performance breakdown appear, helping Taylor identify strengths and areas for improvement.

requirement_tested: Public leaderboard showcasing top performers in each contest
user_persona: Jordan, a socially competitive trivia buff checking global standings.
user_goal: Jordan wants to see where they stand compared to other contestants.

narrative_steps.title: Viewing Leaderboard Rankings
narrative_steps.description: Eager to compare scores, Jordan navigates to the public leaderboard.
narrative_steps.action: Go to /leaderboards/{contestId} route.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Top-ranked players are shown with gold/silver/bronze medals next to names, updating every 30 seconds to maintain accuracy.

narrative_steps.title: Loading More Participants
narrative_steps.description: Wanting to see further down the rankings, Jordan scrolls for additional entries.
narrative_steps.action: Scroll vertically through the leaderboard list.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: More ranked participants load progressively without refreshing the entire dataset, enhancing user experience.

requirement_tested: Performance comparison feature allowing users to view how they rank against others
user_persona: Morgan, a reflective competitor analyzing comparative performance.
user_goal: Morgan wants to visualize how their score stacks up against the average and top performers.

narrative_steps.title: Initiating Comparison View
narrative_steps.description: Having completed a contest, Morgan seeks insight into relative performance.
narrative_steps.action: Access the performance comparison section from the score dashboard.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: A side-by-side bar graph comparing Morgan’s score against the average and top scorer loads dynamically.

narrative_steps.title: Understanding Percentile Rank
narrative_steps.description: Morgan looks for context around their placement among peers.
narrative_steps.action: Examine the comparison visualization and associated metrics.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: A percentile ranking message such as 'You're in the top 15%' is displayed beneath the chart, giving clear performance context.

requirement_tested: Responsive UI design with beige as the base color and saddle brown for all components
user_persona: Alex, a mobile-first user accessing the app on various devices.
user_goal: Alex wants a visually consistent and responsive interface regardless of device type.

narrative_steps.title: Using App on Mobile Device
narrative_steps.description: Alex accesses the trivia app using a smartphone.
narrative_steps.action: Open the app on a mobile browser.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Layout adapts seamlessly to mobile dimensions with beige background (#F5F5DC) and saddle brown (#8B4513) buttons and headers.

narrative_steps.title: Switching to Desktop Experience
narrative_steps.description: Later, Alex switches to a desktop computer to continue playing.
narrative_steps.action: Resize browser window to simulate desktop viewport size.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: UI elements scale appropriately with no loss of color consistency; beige remains dominant background tone and saddle brown highlights interactive components.

requirement_tested: Package.json configured with 'install:all' script to install both frontend and backend dependencies
user_persona: DevOps engineer Sam setting up the project locally for development.
user_goal: Sam wants to simplify dependency installation across both client and server sides.

narrative_steps.title: Running Install Script
narrative_steps.description: Sam clones the repository and prepares to install dependencies for both parts of the stack.
narrative_steps.action: Execute `npm run install:all` from the root directory.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Both frontend and backend dependencies are installed concurrently using the defined script logic, streamlining setup.

requirement_tested: Package.json configured with 'dev' script to start both frontend and backend concurrently
user_persona: Developer Riley beginning daily work on the trivia app.
user_goal: Riley wants to launch both frontend and backend services quickly for local development.

narrative_steps.title: Launching Development Servers
narrative_steps.description: Ready to code, Riley initiates both development environments at once.
narrative_steps.action: Run `npm run dev` from the root directory.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Concurrent processes spawn for both frontend and backend, launching development servers simultaneously for efficient workflow.

requirement_tested: Database schema supporting users, contests, questions, answers, and leaderboard data
user_persona: Database administrator Taylor validating schema integrity.
user_goal: Taylor ensures that all necessary tables exist and relationships are properly enforced.

narrative_steps.title: Inspecting Table Structures
narrative_steps.description: Taylor connects directly to the PostgreSQL database to verify table creation.
narrative_steps.action: Query the database for existing tables matching the defined schema.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Five distinct tables—users, contests, questions, answers, and leaderboard—are present with appropriate columns and constraints including foreign key relationships.

narrative_steps.title: Validating Data Relationships
narrative_steps.description: Taylor checks whether data inserted respects relational integrity.
narrative_steps.action: Insert sample records referencing related entities (e.g., a question linked to a contest).
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Foreign key constraints prevent orphaned or invalid references, ensuring robust data modeling.
